English Language.content:
• **Concord:** Rules of agreement between subject and verb.
• **Lexis:** Synonyms, Antonyms, and Idioms (look for context clues).
• **Oral:** Stress patterns and vowel/consonant sounds.
JAMB frequently tests vocabulary related to Law, Medicine, Agriculture, and Information Technology.

Mathematics.content:
• **Calculus:** Differentiation and Integration of simple functions.
• **Statistics:** Mean, Median, Mode, and standard deviation.
• **Matrices:** Determinants and Inverse of 2x2 matrices.
Understand the Laws of Logarithms: $$log(AB) = log A + log B$$ and $$log(A^n) = n \cdot log A$$.

Physics.content:
• **Mechanics:** Projectiles, Circular Motion, and Newton's Laws.
• **Electricity:** Ohm’s Law and Resistors in series/parallel.
• **Modern Physics:** Radioactivity and Half-life calculations.
Study Mirror and Lens formulas: $$\frac{1}{f} =  rac{1}{u} +  rac{1}{v}$$. Also, focus on Total Internal Reflection.

Chemistry.content:
• **Organic Chemistry:** Alkanes, Alkenes, Alkynes, and Alkanols.
• **Electrolysis:** Faraday’s Laws of Electrolysis.
• **Gas Laws:** Boyle’s, Charles’, and Ideal Gas Law ($$PV = nRT$$).
Know when to use Chromatography, Distillation, and Fractional Crystallization.

Biology.content:
• **Genetics:** Mendelian laws, monohybrid/dihybrid crosses.
• **Ecology:** Biomes, food chains, and energy flow.
• **Form & Function:** Digestive and Respiratory systems in mammals.
Study Darwinism and Lamarckism (Natural Selection vs. Use and Disuse).

Government.content:
• **Constitutional Development:** Clifford, Richards, Macpherson, and Lyttleton constitutions.
• **International Orgs:** ECOWAS, AU, UN, and Commonwealth.
• **Public Admin:** Civil Service and Public Corporations.

Literature-In-English.content:
• **Literary Terms:** Pun, Irony, Paradox, Oxymoron, and Enjambment.
• **Prose/Drama:** Characterization and Themes in the current set books.
• **General Text:** Comprehensive knowledge of 'The Life Changer'.

Financial Accounting.content:
• **Partnership:** Goodwill, profit-sharing, and dissolution.
• **Final Accounts:** Trading, Profit & Loss, and Balance Sheets.
• **Bank Reconciliation:** Correcting the difference between Cash Book and Bank Statement.

Economics.content:
• **Price Theory:** Interaction of Demand and Supply.
• **National Income:** GDP, GNP, and NNP calculations.
• **Inflation:** Causes, types, and control measures.

Agricultural Science.content:
• **Soil Science:** Soil pH, texture, and nutrient cycles (Nitrogen cycle).
• **Crop Production:** Cultivation and storage of cereals and legumes.
• **Livestock:** Management of Poultry, Cattle, and Pigs.

Geography.content:
• **Map Reading:** Calculation of scales, distances, and gradients.
• **Physical Geo:** Weathering, Erosion, and Vulcanicity.
• **Human Geo:** Population distribution and Industrialization in Nigeria.
